 From: Vassilis Vassiliades <vassilisvas@...>
To: neat@yahoogro=
ups.com 
Sent: Wednesday, December 19, 2012 10:59 PM
Subject: Re: [neat] Ap=
plying NEAT to mountain car
 

=C2=A0 
Hi,

Although I haven't tried NEAT o=
n the mountain car problem, I'd like to comment that it can be solved witho=
ut having any hidden nodes in the controller (at least the standard version=
 of the problem). I've tried that by evolving a policy (not a value functio=
n) using (1+1)-CMA-ES and noticed that solutions are found very quickly.=C2=
=A0

Best,
Vassilis



On Wed, Dec 19, 2012 at 3:33 PM, ivalcky <ivalcky@ya=
hoo.com> wrote:

 
>=C2=A0 
>Hi, everyone, I have a problem about neat.
>I =
applied NEAT to the mountain car problem, and I found the result is bad. I =
want to find out why.
>Here are some possilbility I am thinking of. Can any=
one give me any hints and comments.
>The first possibility I thought is the=
 weak ability of the initial population, since there are no hidden nodes, t=
he neural network can not approximate the value function well. In my experi=
ment, it can not achieve the top after 10000 steps. 
>Another reason I cons=
idered is the initial weights of the neural network, learning rate and so o=
n, these parameters should be set carefully, but it takes me a long time, a=
nd I haven't found a better setting.
>I also think the mutation rate is an =
important factor.If I set a small mutation rate, it may take a longer time =
to envolve. If I set a bigger value, does this lead to divergence?
>
>Any f=
eedback is appreciated.
>
>

      <div dir=3D"ltr">Hi,<div><br></div><div>Although =
I haven't tried NEAT on the mountain car problem, I'd like to comment that =
it can be solved without having any hidden nodes in the controller (at leas=
t the standard version of the problem). I've tried that by evolving a polic=
y (not a value function) using (1+1)-CMA-ES and noticed that solutions are =
found very quickly. </div>
<div><br></div><div>Best,</div><div>Vassili=

nk" href=3D"mailto:ivalcky@...">ivalcky@...</a>></span> wrot=
e:<br>
<blockquote class=3D"yiv92446517gmail_quote" style=3D"border-left:1p=
x #ccc solid;">


<u></u>










<div>
<span> </span>


<div>
  <di=
v>


    <div>
      
      
      <div>Hi, everyone, I have a problem abou=
t neat.<br>
I applied NEAT to the mountain car problem, and I found the res=
ult is bad. I want to find out why.<br>
Here are some possilbility I am thi=
nking of. Can anyone give me any hints and comments.<br>
The first possibil=
ity I thought is the weak ability of the initial population, since there ar=
e no hidden nodes, the neural network can not approximate the value functio=
n well. In my experiment, it can not achieve the top after 10000 steps. <br=
>

Another reason I considered is the initial weights of the neural network=
, learning rate and so on, these parameters should be set carefully, but it=
 takes me a long time, and I haven't found a better setting.<br>
I also thi=
nk the mutation rate is an important factor.If I set a small mutation rate,=
 it may take a longer time to envolve. If I set a bigger value, does this l=
ead to divergence?<br>
<br>
Any feedback is appreciated.<br>
<br>
</div>

 =
   </div>
     

    
    <div style=3D"color:#fff;"></div></div></div></di=
v></blockquote></div></div></div>


    </div>
     



</div>
